name: Rising Temperature
desc:
Given a Weather table, write a SQL query to find all dates' Ids with higher temperature compared to its previous (yesterday's) dates.


+---------+------------------+------------------+
| Id(INT) | RecordDate(DATE) | Temperature(INT) |
+---------+------------------+------------------+
|       1 |       2015-01-01 |               10 |
|       2 |       2015-01-02 |               25 |
|       3 |       2015-01-03 |               20 |
|       4 |       2015-01-04 |               30 |
+---------+------------------+------------------+


For example, return the following Ids for the above Weather table:


+----+
| Id |
+----+
|  2 |
|  4 |
+----+

templates.defaultCode: # Write your MySQL query statement below
/* Write your T-SQL query statement below */
/* Write your PL/SQL query statement below */

mysql: Create table If Not Exists Weather (Id int, RecordDate date, Temperature int)
mssql: create table Weather ( Id int, RecordDate date, Temperature int )
oraclesql: create table Weather ( Id int, RecordDate date, Temperature int )
